question: The Constituent Assembly of India became the federal legislature by virtue of which of the following acts?
explanation: On August 15, 1947 India became independent nation as a political fact which was recognised by the international community also. But the Constituent Assembly was a creation of British Government and was sanctioned by the Indian Independence Act 1947, and was constituted by elections held under the Government of India Act 1935 and Cabinet Mission Plan of 1946. It became the first Federal Legislature of independent India by virtue of Indian Independence Act of 1947. The Constitution of India had commenced from January 26, 1950, and, by Article 395 of the Constitution, the Government of India Act 1935, Indian Independence Act 1947 and the Adaptation Laws were repealed along with. Further, Article 372 of the Constitution of India saved all the existing laws evolved and developed in British India in so far as these were not inconsistent with the Constitution of India and these continued as the law of the land.
